alert.note: Alert for Black Mesa Area; Kaibab Plateau; Marble and Glen Canyons; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 8:48PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT COCONINO COUNTY THROUGH 930 PM MST... At 848 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cardiac Canyon, or 11 miles south of Page, moving north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Page, Marble Canyon, Cliff Dwellers, Ramshead Canyon, Cathedral Wash Trailhead, Coppermine Chapter House, Wahweap, Lees Ferry, Butterfly Slot Canyon, Horseshoe Bend, Tower Butte, Canyon X, LeChee, Lee`s Ferry CG, Lower Antelope Canyon, Antelope Island, Big Five, NMS Beach, Stud Horse Point, and Antelope Canyon Near Sr 98. This includes the following highways... State Route 98 between mile markers 548 and 549. U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 519 and 556. U.S. Highway 89A between mile markers 524 and 553. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Black Mesa Area; Kaibab Plateau; Marble and Glen Canyons; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward
